text: Luigi Voghera (1788–1840) was an Italian architect of the Neoclassical period. He was born an active in Cremona. He built a new façade for the church of Sant'Agata in Cremona. He created in 1821 the first design for the Cimitero (Cemetery) of Cremona, but which was not completed till the 20th century with the intervention of other architects.Oltre Magazine, article on Cimitero di Cremona. ==References== Category:19th-century Italian architects Category:People from Cremona Category:1788 births Category:1840 deaths Category:Italian neoclassical architects
title: Luigi Voghera
